title: Assassination of Alboin, King of the Lombards.
text: • 572 – Assassination of Alboin, King of the Lombards.

title: Fighters of the First Crusade defeat Kerbogha of Mosul.
text: • 1098 – Fighters of the First Crusade defeat Kerbogha of Mosul.

title: Muhammed VI becomes the tenth Nasrid king of Granada after killing his brother
text: • 1360 – Muhammed VI becomes the tenth Nasrid king of Granada after killing his brother-in-law Ismail II.

title: Edward IV is crowned King of England.
text: • 1461 – Edward IV is crowned King of England.

title: Charles V is elected Emperor of the Holy Roman Empire.
text: • 1519 – Charles V is elected Emperor of the Holy Roman Empire.

title: Guadeloupe becomes a French colony.
text: • 1635 – Guadeloupe becomes a French colony.

title: The Battle of Berestechko between Poland and Ukraine starts.
text: • 1651 – The Battle of Berestechko between Poland and Ukraine starts.

title: Peter the Great defeats Charles XII of Sweden at the Battle of Poltava.
text: • 1709 – Peter the Great defeats Charles XII of Sweden at the Battle of Poltava.

title: A New England colonial army captures the French fortifications at Louisbourg (New Style).
text: • 1745 – A New England colonial army captures the French fortifications at Louisbourg (New Style).

title: American Revolutionary War: The Battle of Sullivan's Island ends with the American victory, leading to the commemoration of Carolina Day.
text: • 1776 – American Revolutionary War: The Battle of Sullivan's Island ends with the American victory, leading to the commemoration of Carolina Day.

title: American Revolutionary War: Thomas Hickey, Continental Army private and bodyguard to General George Washington, is hanged for mutiny and sedition.
text: • 1776 – American Revolutionary War: Thomas Hickey, Continental Army private and bodyguard to General George Washington, is hanged for mutiny and sedition.

title: American Revolutionary War: The American Continentals engage the British in the Battle of Monmouth Courthouse resulting in standstill and British withdrawal under cover of darkness.
text: • 1778 – American Revolutionary War: The American Continentals engage the British in the Battle of Monmouth Courthouse resulting in standstill and British withdrawal under cover of darkness.

title: Second British invasion of the Río de la Plata; John Whitelocke lands at Ensenada on an attempt to recapture Buenos Aires and is defeated by the locals.
text: • 1807 – Second British invasion of the Río de la Plata; John Whitelocke lands at Ensenada on an attempt to recapture Buenos Aires and is defeated by the locals.

title: Coronation of Queen Victoria of the United Kingdom.
text: • 1838 – Coronation of Queen Victoria of the United Kingdom.

title: The Paris Opera Ballet premieres Giselle in the Salle Le Peletier.
text: • 1841 – The Paris Opera Ballet premieres Giselle in the Salle Le Peletier.

title: Adolphe Sax patents the saxophone.
text: • 1846 – Adolphe Sax patents the saxophone.

title: Sigma Chi fraternity is founded in North America.
text: • 1855 – Sigma Chi fraternity is founded in North America.

title: The first conformation dog show is held in Newcastle upon Tyne, England.
text: • 1859 – The first conformation dog show is held in Newcastle upon Tyne, England.

title: The Army of the Potomac is disbanded.
text: • 1865 – The Army of the Potomac is disbanded.

title: Australian bushranger Ned Kelly is captured at Glenrowan.
text: • 1880 – Australian bushranger Ned Kelly is captured at Glenrowan.

title: The Austro
text: • 1881 – The Austro–Serbian Alliance of 1881 is secretly signed.

title: The Anglo
text: • 1882 – The Anglo-French Convention of 1882 marks the territorial boundaries between Guinea and Sierra Leone.

title: Labor Day becomes an official US holiday.
text: • 1894 – Labor Day becomes an official US holiday.

title: The United States Court of Private Land Claims rules James Reavis' claim to Barony of Arizona is "wholly fictitious and fraudulent."
text: • 1895 – The United States Court of Private Land Claims rules James Reavis' claim to Barony of Arizona is "wholly fictitious and fraudulent."

title: An explosion in the Newton Coal Company's Twin Shaft Mine in Pittston, Pennsylvania results in a massive cave
text: • 1896 – An explosion in the Newton Coal Company's Twin Shaft Mine in Pittston, Pennsylvania results in a massive cave-in that kills 58 miners.

title: The U.S. Congress passes the Spooner Act, authorizing President Theodore Roosevelt to acquire rights from Colombia for the Panama Canal.
text: • 1902 – The U.S. Congress passes the Spooner Act, authorizing President Theodore Roosevelt to acquire rights from Colombia for the Panama Canal.

title: The SS Norge runs aground and sinks.
text: • 1904 – The SS Norge runs aground and sinks.

title: The Nakhla meteorite, the first one to suggest signs of aqueous processes on Mars, falls to Earth, landing in Egypt.
text: • 1911 – The Nakhla meteorite, the first one to suggest signs of aqueous processes on Mars, falls to Earth, landing in Egypt.

title: Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria and his wife Sophie are assassinated in Sarajevo; this is the casus belli of World War I.
text: • 1914 – Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria and his wife Sophie are assassinated in Sarajevo; this is the casus belli of World War I.

title: World War I: Greece declares war to the Central Powers.
text: • 1917 – World War I: Greece declares war to the Central Powers.

title: The Treaty of Versailles is signed, ending the state of war between Germany and the Allies of World War I.
text: • 1919 – The Treaty of Versailles is signed, ending the state of war between Germany and the Allies of World War I.

title: Serbian King Alexander I proclaims the new constitution of the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes, known thereafter as the Vidovdan Constitution.
text: • 1921 – Serbian King Alexander I proclaims the new constitution of the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes, known thereafter as the Vidovdan Constitution.

title: The Irish Civil War begins with the shelling of the Four Courts in Dublin by Free State forces.
text: • 1922 – The Irish Civil War begins with the shelling of the Four Courts in Dublin by Free State forces.

title: Mercedes
text: • 1926 – Mercedes-Benz is formed by Gottlieb Daimler and Karl Benz merging their two companies.

title: The Japanese puppet state of Mengjiang is formed in northern China.
text: • 1936 – The Japanese puppet state of Mengjiang is formed in northern China.

title: Romania cedes Bessarabia (current
text: • 1940 – Romania cedes Bessarabia (current-day Moldova) to the Soviet Union after facing an ultimatum.

title: World War II: Nazi Germany starts its strategic summer offensive against the Soviet Union, codenamed Case Blue.
text: • 1942 – World War II: Nazi Germany starts its strategic summer offensive against the Soviet Union, codenamed Case Blue.

title: Poland's Soviet
text: • 1945 – Poland's Soviet-allied Provisional Government of National Unity is formed over a month after V-E Day.

title: Cold War: The Tito
text: • 1948 – Cold War: The Tito–Stalin Split results in the expulsion of the League of Communists of Yugoslavia from the Cominform.

title: Boxer Dick Turpin beats Vince Hawkins at Villa Park in Birmingham to become the first black British boxing champion in the modern era.
text: • 1948 – Boxer Dick Turpin beats Vince Hawkins at Villa Park in Birmingham to become the first black British boxing champion in the modern era.

title: Korean War: Seoul is captured by North Korean troops.
text: • 1950 – Korean War: Seoul is captured by North Korean troops.

title: Korean War: Suspected communist sympathizers (between as many as 100,000 to 200,000) are executed in the Bodo League massacre.
text: • 1950 – Korean War: Suspected communist sympathizers (between as many as 100,000 to 200,000) are executed in the Bodo League massacre.

title: Korean War: Packed with its own refugees fleeing Seoul and leaving their 5th Division stranded, South Korean forces blow up the Hangang Bridge to in attempt to slow North Korea's offensive.
text: • 1950 – Korean War: Packed with its own refugees fleeing Seoul and leaving their 5th Division stranded, South Korean forces blow up the Hangang Bridge to in attempt to slow North Korea's offensive.

title: Korean War: North Korean Army conducts Seoul National University Hospital massacre.
text: • 1950 – Korean War: North Korean Army conducts Seoul National University Hospital massacre.

title: in Poznań, workers from HCP factory go to the streets, sparking one of the first major protests against communist government both in Poland and Europe.
text: • 1956 – in Poznań, workers from HCP factory go to the streets, sparking one of the first major protests against communist government both in Poland and Europe.

title: Malcolm X forms the Organization of Afro
text: • 1964 – Malcolm X forms the Organization of Afro-American Unity.

title: Stonewall riots begin in New York City, marking the start of the Gay Rights Movement.
text: • 1969 – Stonewall riots begin in New York City, marking the start of the Gay Rights Movement.

title: Elections are held for the Northern Ireland Assembly, which will lead to power
text: • 1973 – Elections are held for the Northern Ireland Assembly, which will lead to power-sharing between unionists and nationalists in Northern Ireland for the first time.

title: The Angolan court sentences US and UK mercenaries to death sentences and prison terms in the Luanda Trial.
text: • 1976 – The Angolan court sentences US and UK mercenaries to death sentences and prison terms in the Luanda Trial.

title: The United States Supreme Court, in Regents of the University of California v. Bakke bars quota systems in college admissions.
text: • 1978 – The United States Supreme Court, in Regents of the University of California v. Bakke bars quota systems in college admissions.

title: A powerful bomb explodes in Tehran, killing 73 officials of the Islamic Republican Party.
text: • 1981 – A powerful bomb explodes in Tehran, killing 73 officials of the Islamic Republican Party.

title: For the first time in military history, a civilian population is targeted for chemical attack when Iraqi warplanes bombed the Iranian town of Sardasht.
text: • 1987 – For the first time in military history, a civilian population is targeted for chemical attack when Iraqi warplanes bombed the Iranian town of Sardasht.

title: On the 600th anniversary of the Battle of Kosovo, Slobodan Milošević delivers the Gazimestan speech at the site of the historic battle.
text: • 1989 – On the 600th anniversary of the Battle of Kosovo, Slobodan Milošević delivers the Gazimestan speech at the site of the historic battle.

title: Holyfield
text: • 1997 – Holyfield–Tyson II: Mike Tyson is disqualified in the third round for biting a piece off Evander Holyfield's ear.

title: Slobodan Milošević is extradited to the ICTY in The Hague to stand trial.
text: • 2001 – Slobodan Milošević is extradited to the ICTY in The Hague to stand trial.

title: Iraq War: Sovereign power is handed to the interim government of Iraq by the Coalition Provisional Authority, ending the U.S.
text: • 2004 – Iraq War: Sovereign power is handed to the interim government of Iraq by the Coalition Provisional Authority, ending the U.S.-led rule of that nation.

title: Honduran president Manuel Zelaya is ousted by a local military coup following a failed request to hold a referendum to rewrite the Honduran Constitution. This was the start of the 2009 Honduran constitutional crisis.
text: • 2009 – Honduran president Manuel Zelaya is ousted by a local military coup following a failed request to hold a referendum to rewrite the Honduran Constitution. This was the start of the 2009 Honduran constitutional crisis.

title: A terrorist attack in Turkey's Istanbul Atatürk Airport kills 42 people and injures more than 230 others.
text: • 2016 – A terrorist attack in Turkey's Istanbul Atatürk Airport kills 42 people and injures more than 230 others.
